org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.plugin

Class AbstractLocalReader

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.keyple.util.Observable<T>
      • org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.plugin.AbstractObservableReader
        • org.eclipse.keyple.seproxy.plugin.AbstractLocalReader
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<ProxyReader>, ProxyReader, Configurable, Nameable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AbstractSelectionLocalReader, AbstractStaticReader

    public abstract class AbstractLocalReader
extends AbstractObservableReader
    Manage the loop processing for SeRequest transmission in a set and for SeResponse reception in a set

    • Method Detail

      • openLogicalChannelAndSelect

        protected abstract SelectionStatus openLogicalChannelAndSelect(SeRequest.Selector selector,
                                                               java.util.Set<java.lang.Integer> successfulSelectionStatusCodes)
                                                        throws KeypleApplicationSelectionException,
                                                               KeypleReaderException
        Open (if needed) a physical channel (try to connect a card to the terminal, attempt to select the application)
        Parameters:
        selector - the SE Selector: either the AID of the application to select or an ATR selection regular expression
        successfulSelectionStatusCodes - the list of successful status code for the select command
        Returns:
        a SelectionStatus object containing the SE ATR, the SE FCI and a flag giving the selection process result. When ATR or FCI are not available, they are set to null
        Throws:
        KeypleReaderException - if a reader error occurs
        KeypleApplicationSelectionException - if the application selection fails

      • closePhysicalChannel

        protected abstract void closePhysicalChannel()
                                      throws KeypleChannelStateException
        Closes the current physical channel.
        Throws:
        KeypleChannelStateException - if a reader error occurs

      • transmitApdu

        protected abstract byte[] transmitApdu(byte[] apduIn)
                                throws KeypleIOReaderException
        Transmits a single APDU and receives its response. The implementation of this abstract method must handle the case where the SE response is 61xy and execute the appropriate get response command
        Parameters:
        apduIn - byte buffer containing the ingoing data
        Returns:
        apduResponse byte buffer containing the outgoing data.
        Throws:
        KeypleIOReaderException - if the transmission fails

      • protocolFlagMatches

        protected abstract boolean protocolFlagMatches(SeProtocol protocolFlag)
                                        throws KeypleReaderException
        Test if the current protocol matches the flag
        Parameters:
        protocolFlag - the protocol flag
        Returns:
        true if the current protocol matches the provided protocol flag
        Throws:
        KeypleReaderException - in case of a reader exception

      • cardRemoved

        protected void cardRemoved()
        This method is invoked when a SE is removed

        The SE will be notified removed only if it has been previously notified present

      • cardInserted

        protected void cardInserted()
        This method is invoked when a SE is inserted

        It will fire an ReaderEvent in the following cases:

        • SE_INSERTED: if no default selection request was defined
        • SE_MATCHED: if a default selection request was defined in any mode a SE matched the selection
        • SE_INSERTED: if a default selection request was defined in ALWAYS mode but no SE matched the selection (the SelectionResponse is however transmitted)

        It will do nothing if a default selection is defined in MATCHED_ONLY mode but no SE matched the selection.

      • processSeRequestSet

        protected final SeResponseSet processSeRequestSet(SeRequestSet requestSet)
                                           throws KeypleReaderException
        Do the transmission of all needed requestSet requests contained in the provided requestSet according to the protocol flag selection logic. The responseSet responses are returned in the responseSet object. The requestSet requests are ordered at application level and the responses match this order. When a requestSet is not matching the current PO, the responseSet responses pushed in the responseSet object is set to null.
        Specified by:
        processSeRequestSet in class AbstractObservableReader
        Parameters:
        requestSet - the request set
        Returns:
        SeResponseSet the response set
        Throws:
        KeypleIOReaderException - if a reader error occurs
        KeypleReaderException

                                     throws java.lang.IllegalStateException,
                                            KeypleReaderException
        Executes a request made of one or more Apdus and receives their answers. The selection of the application is handled.
        Specified by:
        processSeRequest in class AbstractObservableReader
        Parameters:
        seRequest - the SeRequest
        Returns:
        the SeResponse to the SeRequest
        Throws:
        KeypleReaderException - if a transmission fails
        java.lang.IllegalStateException

      • addSeProtocolSetting

        public void addSeProtocolSetting(SeProtocolSetting seProtocolSetting)
        Description copied from interface: ProxyReader
        A protocol setting is a map that establish the link between a protocol identifier and a String that defines how a particular SE may match this protocol.

        For example:

        for a PC/SC plugin the String is defined as a regular expression that will be applied to the ATR in order to identify which type of SE is currently communicating.

        for another plugin (e.g. NFC or proprietary plugin) the String would be any specific word to match a value handled by the low level API of the reader (e.g. "NfcA", "NfcB", "MifareClassic", etc)

        A reader plugin will handle a list of protocol settings in order to target multiple types of SE.

        Parameters:
        seProtocolSetting - the protocol setting to be add to the plugin internal list
